snippet: In his interview with ABC News, President Obama said he wished he had been allowed to announce his change of position on gay marriage on his own timetable, instead of having to quickly follow the vice president's lead.
abstract: In his interview with ABC News, President Obama said he wished he had been allowed to announce his change of position on gay marriage on his own timetable, instead of having to quickly follow the vice president's lead.

headline.main: Biden Got Out 'Over His Skis,' Says Obama

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
